snippet: More than his potential rivals, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin is a product of a loose network that has spent years laying the groundwork for a politician who can promote its ideas.
abstract: Democrats and critics say Wisconsin Gov Scott Walker would not have succeeded in his gubernatorial win, nor in his Republican presidential campaign, without the backing of network of influential conservatives and donors; still, his own ability to go to extremes as he climbed political ladder attracted money and endorsements from conservative allies, and his stand against unions made him a hero to some, especially state's business groups.

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and MONICA DAVEY

lead_paragraph: More than his potential rivals, Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin is a product of a loose network that has spent years laying the groundwork for a politician who can promote its ideas.

headline.main: Behind Scott Walker, a Longstanding Conservative Alliance Against Unions
headline.print_headline: Conservatives and Their Cash Lined Up Early Behind Walker
